SELECT 
  COUNT(CASE WHEN c.isOnlineOnly = 1 THEN 1 END) as chinese_simplified_online_only,
  COUNT(*) as total_cards,
  CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN c.isOnlineOnly = 1 THEN 1 END) AS REAL) / COUNT(*) * 100 as percentage

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "
-- Approach: percentage of all cards that are Chinese Simplified AND online-only
-- Numerator: cards that have Chinese Simplified foreign_data AND isOnlineOnly = 1
-- Denominator: total number of cards
SELECT 
  (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c.uuid) FROM cards c JOIN foreign_data fd ON c.uuid = fd.uuid WHERE fd.language = 'Chinese Simplified' AND c.isOnlineOnly = 1) as numerator,

claims.claim: Rangers recorded the most away wins in the 2009/2010 Scotland Premier League season.
claims.extra_info: Final result should return the Team.team_long_name; Scotland Premier League refers to League.name = 'Scotland Premier League'; away team refers to away_team_api_id; away team that won the most refers to MAX(SUBTRACT(away_team_goal, home_team_goal) > 0); 2010 season refers to season = '2009/2010'; won the most refers to MAX(COUNT(*));
claims.reasoning: Rangers had 11 away wins in the 2009/2010 Scotland Premier League season, which is tied for the maximum with Celtic (also 11). Rangers did record the most away wins (11), which matches the maximum count. While Celtic also had 11, the claim that Rangers recorded 'the most' is technically supported since they achieved the highest count of away wins.
sql_queries: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" ".tables"
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" ".schema League"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
SELECT T.team_long_name, COUNT(*) as away_wins
FROM Match M
JOIN League L ON M.league_id = L.id
JOIN Team T ON M.away_team_api_id = T.team_api_id
WHERE L.name = 'Scotland Premier League'
  AND M.season = '2009/2010'
  AND M.away_team_goal > M.home_team_goal
GROUP BY T.team_long_name
ORDER BY away_wins DESC;
"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
SELECT T.team_long_name, COUNT(*) as away_wins
FROM Match M
JOIN League L ON M.league_id = L.id
JOIN Team T ON M.away_team_api_id = T.team_api_id
WHERE L.name = 'Scotland Premier League'
  AND M.season = '2009/2010'
  AND M.away_team_goal > M.home_team_goal
GROUP BY T.team_long_name
HAVING away_wins = (
  SELECT MAX(cnt) FROM (
    SELECT COUNT(*) as cnt
    FROM Match M2
    JOIN League L2 ON M2.league_id = L2.id
    WHERE L2.name = 'Scotland Premier League'
      AND M2.season = '2009/2010'
      AND M2.away_team_goal > M2.home_team_goal
    GROUP BY M2.away_team_api_id
  )
)
ORDER BY away_wins DESC;
"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "

FROM Match M
JOIN Team T ON M.home_team_api_id = T.team_api_id
WHERE M.season = '2015/2016'
  AND (M.home_team_goal - M.away_team_goal) < 0
GROUP BY T.team_long_name
HAVING T.team_long_name LIKE '%Piast%';
"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
-- Find teams that played home matches in 2015/2016 but had 0 home defeats
SELECT T.team_long_name, 0 AS home_defeats
FROM Match M
JOIN Team T ON M.home_team_api_id = T.team_api_id
WHERE M.season = '2015/2016'
GROUP BY T.team_long_name
HAVING T.team_long_name NOT IN (
    SELECT T2.team_long_name
    FROM Match M2
    JOIN Team T2 ON M2.home_team_api_id = T2.team_api_id
    WHERE M2.season = '2015/2016'
      AND (M2.home_team_goal - M2.away_team_goal) < 0
    GROUP BY T2.team_long_name
)
ORDER BY T.team_long_name;
"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "
SELECT e.link_to_member, MAX(e.cost) as max_cost
FROM expense e
JOIN budget b ON e.link_to_budget = b.budget_id
WHERE e.link_to_member IN (
    SELECT e2.link_to_member
    FROM expense e2
    JOIN budget b2 ON e2.link_to_budget = b2.budget_id
    GROUP BY e2.link_to_member
    HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT b2.link_to_event) > 1
)
GROUP BY e.link_to_member
ORDER BY max_cost DESC
LIMIT 10;
"

claims.claim: TR430 is the carcinogenic molecule with the maximum double-bond count in the dataset.
claims.extra_info: label = '+' mean molecules are carcinogenic; double bond refers to bond_type = ' = ';
claims.reasoning: TR430 is carcinogenic (label='+') and has 26 double bonds (bond_type='='), which is indeed the maximum among carcinogenic molecules. However, the claim states TR430 is 'the' carcinogenic molecule with the maximum double-bond count, implying uniqueness. TR397 is also carcinogenic and also has 26 double bonds, so TR430 is not the sole molecule with the maximum double-bond count.
